intro: Wahlenbergia scoparia var. obovata, commonly known as the Broad-leafed Bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its obovate leaves and vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
